title: Why do some unique passives that only exist on one item have names?
body:
The point of naming unique passives is so they don't stack across multiple items with the same passive, like Spellblade and Rage.

However, there are certain items that have named passives despite said passives ONLY existing on that one item.

Runaan's Hurricane: Wind's Fury
Phantom Dancer: Spectral Waltz and Lament
Dead Man's Plate: Dreadnought and Crushing Blow

Frozen Mallet is the only item that has a passive labeled Icy _(which I know is a hold-over from when Phage's passive was the RNG version of Icy)_, but Iceborn Gauntlet's slowing field is considered Icy in the game engine IIRC, so it only half-counts.

Yeah, just a thought that was on my mind.

_(On an unrelated note, the active on Wooglet's Witchcap isn't named Stasis on the tooltip. This isn't actually an issue at all since Zhonya's doesn't exist on Treeline, but I just found it interesting.)_

replies.body:
Unique passives exist so that they don't stack period. Imagine an assassin with 4 Yoummu's. 80 armor penetration and 4 movespeed and attack speed boosts.

Black cleaver used to have it's armor shred on a non-unique ability and everyone stacked them to get true damage.

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=ZhjEf1nT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-29T19:53:04.981+0000)
>
> Unique passives exist so that they don't stack period. Imagine an assassin with 4 Yoummu's. 80 armor penetration and 4 movespeed and attack speed boosts.
> 
> Black cleaver used to have it's armor shred on a non-unique ability and everyone stacked them to get true damage.

I know what unique passives do.

I'm asking why bother naming them in cases where only that one item even HAS said passive. In which case there's no functional reason to name the passive at all because there are no other items to theoretically stack the effect off of.
Read what he said again.  The reason single items have named passives that are not shared by any other item is **so you cannot stack the item with itself**.

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=ZhjEf1nT,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-29T20:03:47.125+0000)
>
> Read what he said again.  The reason single items have named passives that are not shared by any other item is **so you cannot stack the item with itself**.

In that case, the effect being named doesn't do anything.

Just the "Unique Passive" label by itself prevents that. That's why generic CDR is usually a unique passive on items, so you can't stack that one item for cost-efficient CDR.

If you removed the "Wind's Fury" name from Runaan's passive, you still wouldn't get more bolts from buying another Runaan's because it's still a unique passive. It would only be an issue if you could get bolts from another item that isn't Runaan's Hurricane, but no other item gives bolts.

So you're not complaining about the unique part, you're complaining that they gave it a name?  Really?

Maybe they had plans to add a similar item effect down the road they didn't want stacking with it.  Maybe they felt it was a strong enough effect that it deserved a name.  Maybe they just had a name for it they thought was cool.

Does the name part really matter at all?  No.  The fact that they added a few extra letters to a given unique passive, regardless of reason, really shouldn't bother you.

> Does the name part really matter at all?  No.  The fact that they added a few extra letters to a given unique passive, regardless of reason, really shouldn't bother you.

I'm not complaining about it, just wondering why they did it is all. Like you said, it doesn't mess with anything. I even put this thread in Miscellaneous rather than Gameplay because it's not actually an issue.

The part about adding similar named items down the road is a good hypothesis. Though it just makes me wonder why they made Bloodrazor so weak initially and didn't just name both it and BotRK's passives with the same name. _(I've always assumed Bloodrazor was undertuned specifically so that it wouldn't be absurd when stacked with BotRK, which naming the passive would've fixed just as well.)_

Actually, I think you may have missed his point a bit. Why is the passive *named*? It could just say "UNIQUE Passive:" rather than "UNIQUE Passive - Icy:". Fiendish Codex has its 10% CDR on an unnamed unique passive, and stacking more than one of them doesn't get you any more until you upgrade one.
It's just flavor text -- same with the additional italicized text under Ionian Boots of Lucidity -- and it also covers the case where upgrades/sidegrades to those items get released.
